source: DC 211, U.S.VETS DC, Pathways to Housing DC, Friendship Place

resources.name: DC 211 Answers, Please
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referral service available 24 hours a day connecting DC residents with available social services including veteran-specific programs

resources.name: U.S.VETS Washington D.C.
resources.description: Provides permanent housing with supportive services including employment assistance, mental health and substance use counseling, individualized veteran plans, and suicide prevention

resources.name: DC Department of Human Services - Veteran Affairs Supportive Housing (VASH)
resources.address: 64 New York Avenue, NE, 6th Floor, Washington, DC 20002
resources.description: DC government VASH program providing housing and supportive services for eligible veterans. Hours: Monday to Friday, 8:15 am to 4:45 pm

resources.name: Pathways to Housing DC
resources.description: Provides stable housing for veterans experiencing homelessness with tailored support for mental health, recovery support, employment, and healthcare to help veterans regain independence and thrive

resources.name: Friendship Place - Veterans First
resources.description: Leading provider of rapid rehousing and homeless prevention services for veterans and families. Case management services include housing assistance, benefits connection, employment assistance, and mental health care

resources.name: HUD-VASH Program - National
resources.description: HUD-VASH is a collaborative program pairing HUD's Housing Choice Voucher rental assistance with VA case management and supportive services for homeless veterans and their families. Free, confidential, 24/7 staffed service.

resources.name: VA Washington DC Health Care - Homeless Veteran Care
resources.description: Provides comprehensive behavioral health program with veteran-focused mental health care, substance abuse treatment, and support services for homeless and at-risk veterans

resources.name: DC Department of Employment Services - Veteran Services
resources.description: Provides employment support, job training, resume assistance, and job placement and career coaching for DC veterans

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: Annie B's Serenity Center - Housing & Support for Veterans
resources.description: Provides housing and support resources for veterans in DC and Maryland area
